name: getReportsIdClickDetailsId
description: Get click details for a specific link in a campaign.

fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

exclude_fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

campaign_id.description: The unique id for the campaign.

$block: A report of links clicked in a specific campaign.

$ul: **_links**: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents.
**ab_split**: A breakdown of clicks by different groups of an A/B Split campaign. Does not return information about Multivariate Campaigns.
**a**: Stats for Group A.
**click_percentage_a**: The percentage of total clicks for Group A.
**total_clicks_a**: The total number of clicks for Group A.
**unique_click_percentage_a**: The percentage of unique clicks for Group A.
**unique_clicks_a**: The number of unique clicks for Group A.
**b**: Stats for Group B.
**click_percentage_b**: The percentage of total clicks for Group B.
**total_clicks_b**: The total number of clicks for Group B.
**unique_click_percentage_b**: The percentage of unique clicks for Group B.
**unique_clicks_b**: The number of unique clicks for Group B.
**campaign_id**: The campaign id.
**click_percentage**: The percentage of total clicks a link generated for a campaign.
**id**: The unique id for the link.
**last_click**: The date and time for the last recorded click for a link in ISO 8601 format.
**total_clicks**: The number of total clicks for a link.
**unique_click_percentage**: The percentage of unique clicks a link generated for a campaign.
**unique_clicks**: Number of unique clicks for a link.
**url**: The URL for the link in the campaign.

$block: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF draft 'draft-nottingham-http-problem-06'.

$ul: **detail**: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem. [Learn more about errors](/developer/guides/get-started-with-mailchimp-api-3/#Errors).
**instance**: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem. Please provide this ID when contacting support.
**status**: The HTTP status code (RFC2616, Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.
**title**: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type. It shouldn't change based on the occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.
**type**: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type. When dereferenced, it should provide human-readable documentation for the problem type.
